title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Friday, 18 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: peterborough serial killer joanna dennehy was under the supervision of probation workers when she carried out three murders and two stabbings , the bbc has learned .
a guided bus that crashed near cambridge injuring five passengers was travelling at more than 50mph in a 30mph zone , a report says .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our coverage through the day
text: we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for cambridgeshire .
until then you can get involved and send us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
have a great weekend .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : staying settled with mostly cloudy skies , but generally staying dry
text: overnight there will be thick cloud around for most of us , and perhaps even the odd spot of drizzle on higher ground .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
it will stay mostly cloudy throughout the day tomorrow , but some brighter spells could develop during the afternoon .
there is also the risk of seeing the odd light shower for some .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: daisy the donkey in palm sunday performance
text: a 25-year old-donkey called daisy will be leading the palm sunday procession at ely cathedral this weekend .
the procession marks the start of holy week and commemorates christ 's entry into jerusalem , riding on a donkey .
daisy is much in demand at this time of year .
owner liz wright , from wimblington says : `` i ca n't count the number of people that have rung me in the last week and asked if i have a donkey for their palm sunday . ''

documents.title: new fleet of trains will increase speeds and seat numbers on east coast mainline
text: a new fleet of trains will cut journey times and increase seat numbers along the east coast mainline .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: headlines : guided bus crash caused by excessive speed joanne dennehy under probation watch at time of murders
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man in 30s taken to hospital after accident with bus
text: the ambulance services says a man in his 30s has been taken to addenbrooke 's hospital with leg and back injuries after an accident with a bus on bridge street , cambridge .
his injuries are not believed to be life-threatening .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: pedestrian involved in accident with bus not believed to have life-threatening injuries , say police
text: police have told us the injuries suffered by a pedestrian in an accident with a bus in cambridge are not believed to be life-threatening .
bridge street is expected to remain closed for a time , with emergency services at the scene .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus and pedestrian involved in 'serious ' accident on bridge street in cambridge
text: the ambulance service says a bus and a pedestrian have been involved in a `` serious '' accident on bridge street in cambridge .
more when we get it .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'serious ' accident closes bridge street in cambridge
text: a `` serious '' accident has closed bridge street in the centre of cambridge .
emergency services are at the scene .
please be aware that we have had to close bridge street in cambridge due to a serious rtc .
emergency services on scene

documents.title: investigation launched after hauxton resident 's wheelchair 'taken ' in row over taxi fare
text: a woman from cambridgeshire has described the moment she was left without her wheelchair after a dispute over payment saw a taxi driver keep it overnight .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: glue-eating dog 'regains ' his normal appetite
text: a dog which had to have an hour-long operation to cut open his stomach to remove a large ball of glue is back home .
marley , a seven-month-old cocker spaniel from hitcham near stowmarket , ate a tube of expanding adhesive which congealed with his food into a 6ins ( 15cm ) diameter ball .
a spokeswoman for dick white referrals vets in cambridgeshire said he had `` regained his full appetite - he just needs to be a little more discerning about his snacks '' .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge university gives fenland pupils a taste of engineering
text: pupils from six fenland schools are taking part in a programme designed by the university of cambridge to encourage students interested in engineering and manufacturing .
the university 's engineering taster events are hosted by metalcraft , a chatteris-based manufacturer that has made equipment for the large hadron collider .

matt diston , from cambridge university , said : `` our work is n't just about inspiring students to apply to top universities , it 's about encouraging all young people to fulfil their potential and pursue a rewarding career path . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: guided bus still being investigated by hse
text: the health and safety executive is still conducting its investigation into a crash on the guided busway , which cambridgeshire county council says was caused by `` excessive speed '' .
the driver of the bus that crashed off the cambridgeshire guided busway on 22 february , injuring six people , was recently sacked by bus operator stagecoach .
andy campbell , managing director of stagecoach east , says : `` the investigation found that the driver did n't follow proper procedures , which is why he no longer works for the company .
`` more than 3.5m passengers use the guided busway every year ; it 's significantly safer than the a14 and other major roads . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire police lend a hand to support fight campaign against child exploitation
text: members of cambridgeshire police , including chief constable alec wood ( are showing their support for national child sexual exploitation awareness day today .
the day aims to highlight the issues surrounding exploitation and encourage people to speak out against abuse .
further information and support can be found here - child sexual exploitation - can you spot the signs ?
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: one-hour operation for dog that ate tube of expanding glue
text: a dog that ate a tube of expanding glue had to have an hour-long operation .
marley , a black cocker spaniel from hitcham near stowmarket , ended up with a congealed ball of food and glue stuck in his stomach .
dick white referrals vets at six mile bottom near newmarket said the dog appeared to be showing no ill effects and was ready to go home a day later .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: joanne dennehy : the woman with a 'sadistic lust for blood '
text: triple killer joanne dennehy was under the supervision of probation workers when she murdered three men , it has emerged .
during her trial , the judge said she had a `` sadistic lust for blood '' .
here are some of the key points about her case :

documents.title: sport relief : peterborough pupils playing 24-hour football match
text: today is the start of sport relief weekend , with people doing a number of sporting challenges to raise money for charity .
pupils at nene park academy in peterborough began a 24-hour football match at 07:00 this morning .
we 'd love to know what you 're doing for sport relief.. you can send us your
and remember , tonight 's sport relief show gets under way on bbc one at 19:00 .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : generally cloudy but staying settled
text: it will be mostly cloudy this afternoon and will feel chilly with the risk of drizzle at times .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
weather watcher `` cat 's pad '' took this near histon earlier .
you can see more images from around the county here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pet dog recovering after glue-eating ordeal
text: a dog is recovering after eating a tube of expanding glue .

marley , a seven-month-old cocker spaniel from hitcham , in suffolk , had to have a solid congealed lump of food and glue removed from his stomach by a surgeon at dick white referrals vets in six mile bottom near newmarket .
the ball of glue and food measured about 6ins ( 15cm ) in diameter .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: headlines : joanne dennehy under supervision of probation service at time of murders guided bus crash 'driver error '
text: if you are just joining us , here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: kate to open new children 's hos charity shop
text: the duchess of cambridge is to open a new charity shop for east anglia 's children 's hos today .
the duchess is a patron of the charity which runs hos for terminally ill children , including one at milton near cambridge
this afternoon she is cutting the ribbon on each 's 21st charity shop - at holt in norfolk .

documents.title: cctv captures 50mph guided busway crash
text: the moment a bus crashed on the guided busway in cambridge , injuring five people , was captured on cctv cameras .
the images show the bus approaching the dualled section of track which it makes contact with on its passenger side .
having lost its guide wheel the speeding bus skidded , left the track and crashed across a maintenance road before coming to rest on a verge , near foster road on 22 february .
a report by cambridgeshire county council concluded the driver 's `` excessive speed '' indicated he was `` either inattentive or overconfident '' .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: busway crash happened between sections of track
text: the county council report into the busway crash said it happened as the driver was moving from a single guided carriageway to a dual carriageway - a point at which he is expected to steer the vehicle to ensure correct alignment between the tracks .

conditions at the time were dry and visibility was good , however cctv images `` showed the bus being thrown from one side of the guideway section to the other , before being thrown onto the adjacent maintenance track and up onto the verge '' .
investigations showed the vehicle was travelling at about 53.6mph in a 30mph zone on the approach to the dualled track .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: guided busway crash : 'unlikely the bus was under the driver 's control '
text: a report into a crash on the guided busway in cambridge has found it was `` unlikely the bus was under the driver 's control '' .
the cambridgeshire county council report into the accident , which left five people injured , said it happened as the bus was moving from a single track section of busway to a dual section .
the report concludes the driver 's `` excessive speed '' indicated he was `` either inattentive or overconfident '' .
the driver was dismissed after the accident by operator stagecoach .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: breakingguided busway crash caused by 'excessive speed '
text: a guided bus that crashed near cambridge injuring five passengers was travelling at more than 50mph in a 30mph zone , a report by cambridgeshire county council has concluded .
the bus left the tracks and crashed into a bank , near foster road , on 22 february .
more to follow .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: joanne dennehy : widow of victim criticises probation service
text: the widow of one of joanne dennehy 's victims has told the bbc she has been left `` wondering whether her husband would still be alive today '' had probation officers `` done their job properly '' .

the bbc can reveal the triple killer , who dumped the bodies of three men in ditches in the fens in 2013 , was under the supervision of probation services having been given a community order for assault and being in control of a dangerous dog .

cristina lee , widow of victim kevin lee , said she was `` left numb '' by the failings identified in the cambridgeshire and peterborough probation trust report , which says a `` more experienced offender manager '' should have been appointed to deal with the `` complexities '' of the case .
in the report the probation service admitted failings , but said they did not directly contribute to the killings .
it has been contacted for further comment .
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: crash in wisbech brings down power cables
text: high voltage power cables have been brought down in a crash in wisbech .
police are advising people to avoid the area .
road traffic collision barton road and bevis lane wisbech is closed at the junction of lords lane , high voltage power cables taken down
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: american air museum at duxford prepares for public reopening
text: the american air museum at duxford is undergoing final preparations ahead of reopening to the public this weekend .
the collection closed to the public last march to allow for the £ 3m redevelopment by the imperial war museum , and yesterday the duke of kent came to inspect its progress .
the museum said the attraction will tell the story of the british-american relationship in `` human terms '' .
nearly 20 aircraft are on display , some suspended as if in flight .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: guided busway crash report set to be revealed this morning
text: a report saying what led to a crash on the guided busway in cambridge is set to be made public this morning .
five people were injured when a bus left the tracks and crashed into a bank , near foster road , on 22 february .
cambridgeshire county council , which runs the busway , will release its findings at 11:00 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mother praises off-duty special sergeant for helping babies off the a14
text: a mother has praised an off-duty special sergeant who took a couple 's six-month-old twins off the a14 to safety after her car engine started smoking .
fearing it would burst into flames , nicola smith managed to get daughters emily and olivia out of the car near huntingdon .
witnessing what happened , special sergeant paul jenkins ( over and took the family to the nearby services .

miss smith , terrified that the twins born seven-weeks premature would not be able to cope with the cold , praised mr jenkins , saying : `` i genuinely believe his actions may well have saved my babies ' lives that day . ''

documents.title: travel : a47 blocked following crash near wisbech
text: the a47 is blocked eastbound , between the a141 junction for guyhirn and the b198 for wisbech , following a crash .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: joanne dennehy 'under supervision of probation workers ' during killings
text: peterborough triple killer joanne dennehy was under the supervision of probation workers when she murdered three men and stabbed two others in frenzied attacks three years ago , a leaked report has revealed .
the bbc has obtained a `` restricted '' report by the cambridgeshire and peterborough probation trust that reveals she had been identified as a potential risk for causing `` serious harm '' .
it admits there were some `` deficiencies in practice '' during the supervision , but it adds there was no evidence the errors `` contributed directly '' to the killings .
the trust added it was `` determined '' to learn from the failings .
earlier this week , the ministry of justice confirmed dennehy won legal aid to fight for compensation over being segregated in prison .
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: illicit tobacco seized from peterborough shops
text: thousands of illicit cigarettes have been seized from peterborough shops following raids in the city .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: new £ 550k public art paying homage to the cam is 'one-off chance to provide a legacy ' for cambridge
text: the woman charged with looking after cambridge 's city centre and open spaces has vowed to help create a landmark piece of public art `` that provides a legacy for the whole of cambridge '' .
author: Cambridge News

author: Sam Edwards

documents.title: weather : generally cloudy but staying settled
text: it 'll be a dull start with drizzle in places and any fog will slowly lift .
it will remain cloudy and will feel chilly through the day with further rain at times .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
head to bbc weather to watch my full forecast .

text: hello again , thanks for joining us .
stay posted as we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for cambridgeshire until 18:00 .
we 've a full weather forecast coming next , and do n't forget , you can get involved with our live page at any time .
